Title: Provision of Assessment Centre Design & Delivery for the Finance Graduate Scheme

Title: For the provision of External Advertising and Typesetting / Alternative Formats
Description:
The requirement is for the provision of External Advertising and Typesetting/ Alternative formats. The provider shall deliver an overall value for money service in terms of savings achieved through innovation, efficiencies and continuous improvement.

Although we envisage that the successful bidder will carry out support for all appointments requiring advertising services, DH reserves the right to contract with a different organisation if it feels that the successful bidder is unable to meet its requirements.

In addition we are looking for a supplier who can produce our advert and information packs in alternative formats and on occasion a foreign language.

The contract will be established for an initial period of one (1) year. The contract will have an option to extend for a further period or periods up to a total of two (2) years, subject to satisfactory service delivery, taking the contract term to a maximum of three (3) years from the Commencement Date

Title: Price Review Analysts, PR19
Description:
The objective of this contract is to undertake effective advertising, search, selection and candidate management processes to recruit circa 25 Price Review Analysts on 2 year fixed term contracts (FTC), to start ideally from 1 January 2018 and no later than 1 April 2018. These roles will be at Senior Associate (band 3 GBP 32,363 - GBP 48,406) and Principal (band 4 GBP 48,407 - GBP 74,042) level. The intention is that these new recruits will work primarily on our Price Review and will be recruited into our Analytics and Strategy & Policy Resource Pools. The information for applicants pack and person specifications by profession are attached at Appendix A and B respectively within the ITT. If the campaign is successful, we may review our budget position and recruit further roles above the circa. 25 outlined in this tender.  

These roles are:

- Finance and accounting

- Engineering and infrastructure

- Economics

- Information and quality assurance

- Strategy and policy

- Regulatory analysts

Ideally we are looking for an even mix of skillsets and we would expect 60% of appointments to be at Senior Associate level and 40% at Principal level.

As these are specialist roles that can be difficult to fill and candidates are required to start from 1 January 2018 to 1 April 2018, we are taking a number of different approaches to filling these vacancies. This is to ensure that we get right calibre of candidates within the timescales we require. We will go live with our own recruitment campaign in September 2017 led by a dedicated internal resourcer, we will advertise on our website, Civil Service jobs and LinkedIn as well as placing a number of online adverts. We will also tap into the UK Regulators Network advertising loans and secondments as an alternative attraction method. The final component of our campaign is to secure the services of a third party agency or agencies to source high calibre candidates. As we are looking for a range of specialist skills for both our London and Birmingham offices, we intend to award this service to at least 1 and up to 3 Suppliers. It is essential that the Supplier or mix of Suppliers can deliver candidates at both locations.

Scope of work

We are looking for a Supplier/s who will invest time to quickly get up to speed with what Ofwat does and our Price Review and the type of skills we are looking for. The Supplier would need to be creative in how they approach the end to end campaign, undertaking effective advertising, search and selection processes using a range of methods and present a high quality and diverse field of suitable candidates. In the past we have experienced some difficulties securing suitable candidates for these type of vacancies as the skills are very specialist and can be hard to find and in short supply. We are interested in proposals for how these issues would be overcome.

Title: The Provision of Advertisement Services for Statutory Public Notices
Description:

 The Council is seeking to appoint a Media Advertising Agency to act as a broker to produce and place the public notice advertisement on its behalf.

Title: Recruitment Advertising Services
Description: The University sought to appoint an agency or agencies to manage the process for handling its staff recruitment advertising.  The need was for focused recruitment advertising that adds value and a competitive edge to the University’s recruitment process.  The agencies will be tasked with addressing the recruitment needs of the University, to keep advertising and handling costs to a minimum commensurate with required quality, and comply with relevant legislation relating to recruitment advertising.

Title: Attraction
Description: CQC are seeking to procure a candidate attraction partner to support recruitment activity by supporting the development of innovative attraction strategies, including social media campaigns and other specialist strategies, and deliver cost effective attraction activities. Priority campaigns will be the attraction and recruitment of 600 frontline Inspection staff (inspectors and Inspection Managers) and c.50 – 80 Intelligence colleagues (specifically Analysts) in the first year, as well as a number of smaller volume recruitment campaigns for individual roles across the organisation in the first year and beyond.
Attachments: 20150604 Redacted CQC PER 002 CQC Attraction Services - TMP (UK Ltd).pdf

Title: Provision of Advertising
Description:
The Recruitment Team manages the recruitment of all Home Office Senior Civil
Servants (SCS) and Public Appointees (appointments made by Ministers or the
Queen to Home Office sponsored public bodies or public offices).

Home Office usually advertises between 15-30 SCS roles externally on an annual
basis. These are the most senior roles in the department, many of which will have a
high public profile and/or be in specialist fields such as commercial, programme
management and digital.

Home Office is responsible for over 190 public appointments. These include Her
Majesty’s Inspectors of Constabulary, the Independent Reviewer of Terrorism
Legislation, the Biometrics Commissioner, Chair and Board Members of the
Gangmasters Licensing Authority, the Disclosure and Barring Service, the Security
Industry Authority and the Advisory Council on the Misuse of Drugs. All posts have
to be filled on merit via fair and open competition so, where there is no possibility of
re-appointment for existing post holders, an external competition has to be run. On
average 10-20 public appointment campaigns are run within a 12 month period.

Title: Framework agreement for CAA recruitment services
Description: Framework agreement for CAA recruitment services - The CAA Resourcing Team currently operates a direct sourcing model involving LinkedIn engagement, advertisement, social media and various online sourcing techniques. The purpose of the Framework is to establish a list of preferred supplier (PSL) that would be used to fill vacancies which are of a senior level, specialist/niche roles or roles that the team have struggled to source via the direct sourcing approach.
